lead_paragraph: A whistle-blower claims that the mutual fund group, which is ultimately owned by investors in its funds, should have to account for profits it could have earned if it had charged higher fees.

headline.print_headline: The Cost Cutter vs. the Tax Collector
headline.main: Vanguard, a Champion of Low Fees, Faces a Peculiar Tax Challenge

snippet: A whistle-blower claims that the mutual fund group, which is ultimately owned by investors in its funds, should have to account for profits it could have earned if it had charged higher fees.
abstract: Jeff Sommer Strategies column examines Vanguard Group’s alleged tax violation related to its commitment to keep investment fees low; authorities are investigating claim by David Danon, whistle-blower and former Vanguard tax lawyer, that mutual fund company violated transfer-pricing rules by not paying taxes on possible profits, and may owe billions of dollars.
